column4: the only thing I really like about the no-root way that Ubuntu uses is that by forcing use of sudo, you get a nice log of root actions
other than that, I still prefer the traditional root account system.
it was what I was used to, and I liked it. I'm getting used to this and liking it too
yes, it's not a big deal. I don't really mind it. I'm used to it now after so many months
